description.narrative: The Cooperation Committee for Cambodia (CCC) is the largest membership based platform for Non-Governmental Organizations (NGOs) in Cambodia. This coalition constitutes more than 160 international and local non-governmental organizations (NGOs), working on different development sectors in the country. CCC is deeply recognized for its leadership, coordination, advocacy, and networking among alldevelopment actors to 1). Promote good governance and institutional effectiveness; and 2). Improve the enabling environment and inclusive partnerships for development. CCC has been in partnership with Oxfam in Cambodia working on improving and strengthening civicspace. Through the previous program implementation, and the momentum that have been achieved, Oxfam in Cambodia, in partnership with CCC will further cooperate to promote and strengthen civic space on the project #Establishing Harmonization and Visibility of Civil Society in Cambodia for Inclusive Development.# The overall objective of the project is a strong and capable civil society organization cooperating and responsive to Cambodia#s development challenges. This will be specific to i). to increase space and dialogue platforms for civil society organization to address their environment challenges ii). To enhance multi-stakeholder partnership which enable CSOs# participation for inclusive development and iii). To enhance the collaboration and harmonization, particularly within civil society sector. Expected outputs: - CSO roadmap and CSO strategy which entails the join efforts among civil society to address their common enabling environment and overall development challenges. - IEC materials related to the CSO roadmap and CSO strategy produced and disseminated to target beneficiaries - Civil SocietyDay which bring representatives of CSOs from different networks to endorse and prepare for joint efforts on CSO roadmap and CSO strategy. - Mapping of the invited spaces for CSOs in Cambodia according to the new mechanisms as stated in the new Development Cooperation and Partnership Strategy (DCPS). - Dialogues/platforms established between CSOs membership based/networks, CSOs and other stakeholders. These include the dialogues between CSOs (members and provincial networks) with other stakeholders suchas DP and government. - Multi-stakeholder partnership guidelines for inclusive developmentat sub-national level. - CCC members and partners enhanced their capacity to respond to the enabling environment challenges The expected outcomes: - Civil society in Cambodia acted in solidarity to support their common CSO roadmap and CSO strategy. - CSOs have contributed their inputs and taken benefits from invited spaces of engagement with the government and other development stakeholders -Multi-stakeholdersto realize the inclusive and sustainable development in Cambodia

participating-org.narrative: The Cooperation Coomiitee for Cambodia (CCC) was established in 1990 as an association of Civil Society Organisations in Cambodia. It is a leading network strengthening the cooperation, professionalism, accountability, governance and effectiveness of itsmembers and representing the sector to the government and donors. It aims to contribute to a cohesive, accountable and transparent NGO sector, contributing more effectively to the development of Cambodia.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation
